title: UX-designer
description:
### **Din nya roll**


Vi söker en erfaren och självgående UX-designer som vill vara med och utveckla en central del av ett nytt trafikhanteringssystem – en beställnings- och avtalswebbportal. Portalen är avgörande för hanteringen av resebeställningar, resegarantier och trafikflöden, och ditt arbete kommer direkt påverka både externa och interna användare.


Som UX-designer ansvarar du för hela användarupplevelsen och driver designprocessen från behovsanalys och konceptutveckling till validerad design. Du arbetar nära användare för att förstå deras behov, genomför användningstester och tar fram prototyper i Figma. Du säkerställer att lösningen är anpassad för både yrkesanvändare och interna team, med effektiva arbetsflöden och intuitiva gränssnitt.

**Arbetsuppgifter:**


- Driva designprocessen för beställnings- och avtalswebbportalen  

* Genomföra användarintervjuer, tester och research
* Ta fram koncept, UX-flöden och prototyper i Figma
* Prioritera funktionalitet och säkerställa att kritiska behov tillgodoses
* Sammanställa och presentera insikter och designbeslut till team och intressenter

### **Företagspresentation**


Vår kund är en myndighet i Stockholm som arbetar för att underlätta vardagen för invånarna som reser och pendlar. Det som kännetecknar deras verksamhet är det stora engagemanget bland deras medarbetare samt stoltheten över deras samhällsuppdrag.

### **Bra att känna till**

* Uppdragets omfattning: Heltid, 40 timmar per vecka


* Anställningsform: Tidsbegränsad anställning som konsult via JobBusters

  

* Arbetsmodell: På plats i Stockholm

  

* Lön: Enligt överenskommelse

  

* Start: 2025-12-08

  

* Slut: 2026-12-31, med möjlighet till förlängning

  

* Sista ansökningsdag: 2025-12-08

  

* I din ansökan: Ange tydligt hur du uppfyller kvalifikationerna


### **För att bli framgångsrik i denna roll behöver du**

* Erfarenhet av UX-design i större organisationer med komplexa tjänster


* + Stark metodkompetens och förmåga att leda hela designprocessen
* + Förmåga att ta fram koncept, flöden och prototyper, gärna i Figma
* + Personliga egenskaper: Självgående, kommunikativ och lösningsorienterad



### **Vi erbjuder**

* Trygg anställning med kollektivavtal, försäkringar och tjänstepension
* Friskvårdsbidrag samt personalrabatter och erbjudanden via Benifex (ex. inom hälsa, fritid, transport och sjukvård)
* Flexpension och tillgång till Lifeplan pensionstjänst
* Extra ersättning vid föräldraledighet
* Företagshälsovård
* Långsiktiga uppdrag och personlig kontakt med din konsultchef
* Möjlighet att bygga värdefull erfarenhet, nätverk och framtida utveckling
* 

### **Välkommen med din ansökan**

  

Vi går igenom ansökningarna löpande. Då processerna i konsultvärlden ofta går snabbt kan tjänsten tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdatum – vänta därför inte med att skicka in din ansökan!


Du behöver inte skriva ett personligt brev utan i stället ber vi dig svara på urvalsfrågorna i samband med ansökan.

title: Specialist inom teknisk information till fordonsdiagnostik - Stockholm
description:
### **Om uppdraget**

Vi söker en Technical Information Specialist som ansvarar för att ta fram diagnostikrelaterad serviceinformation som hjälper verkstäder att snabbt och korrekt felsöka, kalibrera och reparera fordon. Informationen ska vara tydlig, standardiserad och integrerad i diagnostikverktyget SWS (Workshop Suite). Du blir en viktig del i kedjan mellan teknikutveckling och verkstadens vardag, där kvalitet och användbarhet i dokumentationen är avgörande.


### **Dina arbetsuppgifter**

Skapa och uppdatera diagnostik- och serviceinformation för verkstadsmiljö.


Ta fram felkodstexter, komponentinformation och funktionsbeskrivningar.


Utveckla steg-för-steg-guider för diagnos och kalibrering.


Producera UI-texter och samarbeta med utveckling för korrekt implementering i SWS.


Koordinera innehållsflödet i interna verktyg och säkerställa standardisering.


Bidra med tekniska illustrationer och visuella förklaringar vid behov.


### **Förväntade leveranser**

Färdiga felkodstexter och diagnostiska guider i SWS.


Standardiserad komponent- och funktionsinformation.


Tydliga UI-texter anpassade för verkstadsanvändare.


Spårbart, kvalitetssäkrat innehåll enligt interna processer.


Löpande förbättring av informationsstruktur och användarvänlighet.


### **Din profil**

Relevant utbildning och/eller erfarenhet inom teknisk kommunikation/technical writing, IT eller närliggande teknikområde.


God teknisk grundförståelse och intresse för fordon/fordonsteknik.


Van att skriva strukturerat, målgruppsanpassat och enligt standarder.


Meriterande med kunskap inom AI-stöd i tekniskt skrivande.


Meriterande med UX- och/eller front-end-förståelse.


Mycket god kommunikationsförmåga på svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift.


### **Personliga egenskaper**

Noggrann och kvalitetsmedveten med känsla för detaljer.


Strukturerad och självgående i att driva leveranser i tid.


Pedagogisk och användarfokuserad – gillar att göra komplex teknik begriplig.


Samarbetsorienterad och trivs i gränslandet mellan teknik, produkt och användare.


**Plats:** Stockholm (hybrid, minst 3 dagar/vecka på plats)  

**Omfattning:** Heltid 100%  

**Period:** 2026-02-02 – 2028-01-31 (goda möjligheter till förlängning)  

**Sista ansökningsdag:** 28 november 2025


Urval sker löpande. Bakgrundskontroll genomförs innan uppdragsstart.


Sway Sourcing är en innovativ rekryteringspartner som specialiserar sig på att matcha rätt talang med rätt företag – snabbt och effektivt. Vårt huvudfokus ligger inom Ekonomi, Administration, HR, Marknad och IT, men vi har även den breda expertis och flexibilitet som krävs för att leverera skräddarsydda rekryteringslösningar inom alla branscher.


Trots att vi är en relativt ny aktör har vi redan byggt förtroende hos många av Sveriges största företag och arbetar både nationellt och internationellt. Med baser i Sverige och Spanien erbjuder vi en unik kombination av lokal expertis och global räckvidd. Vårt starka nätverk och djupa branschinsikter gör oss till en självklar partner för företag som vill ligga steget före i sin rekrytering.

title: UX/UI designer
description:
**About Magma Math**
 Magma is one of the world’s fastest-growing and most celebrated edtech companies, transforming math education through the power of AI. Our platform turns handwritten solutions into digital insights, empowering teachers to focus on creativity and deeper learning — while giving them real-time visibility into student progress.
   

  

 The result? More inclusive, engaging, and effective math classrooms for all learners.
   

  

 But we’re not just building better tools. We’re tackling one of the biggest challenges in global education: math underperformance. With 1 in 5 students globally struggling in math — a subject that forms the backbone of so many career paths — we believe the opportunity to improve outcomes at scale is massive.
   

  

 We’re already the go-to solution in thousands of schools — and we’re just getting started. As we expand rapidly across the U.S. and Europe, we’re building a team as ambitious as our mission: to help millions of students unlock their full potential in math.
   

  

**The Role**
 We're looking for a
 **UX/UI Designer** 
 to join our product team in Stockholm.
   

  

 In this role, your designs will quickly move from concept to reality. You’ll sketch, prototype, and refine solutions that are shipped into classrooms and districts across the world, where they’re put to use right away. That means you’ll get to see the impact of your work almost immediately - and improve it through real feedback.
   

  

 You’ll collaborate with product managers, engineers, and users to make sure every design is both functional and valuable. As you gain experience, there’s also space to step into greater design ownership of one specific product platform.‍
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Create user flows, wireframes and hi-fi designs in Figma.
* Translate defined problems and solutions into clear, user-friendly designs.
* Collaborate closely with product managers, designer and engineers.
* Work across the teacher and district platforms, with the potential to fully own the design on district platform long-term.
* Engage with users — from classroom teachers to district leaders — to ground designs in real needs.‍


**Who You Are**
* Background in product design (academic or equivalent work experience).
* Someone who enjoys solving problems and finding practical solutions.
* Curious and eager to learn, with a growth mindset.
* Comfortable working in a fast-paced, iterative environment, where features are released regularly and improved over time.
* Enjoys making sure every design is pixel perfect.
* Experience working with Design Systems.‍


**What We Offer**
* Regular visits to schools to see the product in action.
* A role in a small but growing product team where your work will have visible impact.
* Fantastic colleagues in a fun environment with great opportunities to learn
* Competitive salary and benefits including pension, insurance, and wellness perks.
* Annual company trip
* An opportunity to work on a meaningful mission and have an exceptional impact on education, society and how children learn math across the world ‍


**Start** 
 : As soon as possible
   

  

**Location** 
 : Stockholm, Sweden
   

  

**Our recruitment process (all in office):**
 1st interview with Hiring Manager and Head of People
   

  

 2nd interview with Hiring Manager and Magma member
   

  

 3rd interview with Founders and Magma member

title: Digital Creative
description:
**Job Description**

 As a
 **Digital Creative** 
 you will create visually engaging content for digital environments, platforms, and channels. This role focuses on executing creative concepts into production-ready assets for both digital and print channels, ensuring brand consistency and excellence.
   

  





**WHAT YOU’LL DO**



* Execute design creation for campaigns, social media, e-commerce, newsletters, and store communication (moving and still content, including final art).
* Create motion graphics and video content for social media, e-commerce, and other platforms.
* Collaborate with creatives and production managers to ensure cohesive and impactful digital execution.
* Contribute to ideation sessions and pitch solutions to creatives.
* Stay updated on digital trends, technologies, and platform updates to inform creative decisions.
* Adapt creative content for various digital channels, ensuring alignment with brand guidelines.



**WHO YOU’LL WORK WITH**




 You will work closely with creatives, production managers, and cross-functional teams to deliver high-quality digital content across multiple platforms.
   

  





**WHO YOU ARE**





 We are looking for people with…
   

  





* Proven experience in digital production, creative development, and handling large volumes of assets.
* Proficiency in Adobe Creative Suite, After Effects, and Figma.
* A portfolio showcasing digital-first thinking and execution, with ability to translate graphic ideas into channel-specific formats.
* Knowledge of performance marketing and optimizing creative content for maximum effect.
* Strong understanding of adapting creative content for digital formats (moving content, social media assets, banners).




 And people who are…
   

  





* Self-driven with strong initiative and ability to finalize assets for both print and digital channels.
* Solution-oriented with a proactive mindset for improving workflows and asset delivery.
* Clear communicators with strong collaboration skills.



**ADDITIONAL INFORMATION**




 This is a
 **full-time permanent position** 
 based at our Head Office in Stockholm.
   

  

 If you feel this opportunity is exciting, feel free to apply by sending in your
 **CV and portfolio in English** 
 as soon as possible, but no later than
 **1st Dec, 2025** 
 . Due to data policies, we only accept applications through our career page.
   

  





 We value collaboration and believe that great ideas thrive when we work closely together. Therefore, this role is primarily office-based, with four days per week at the office to foster teamwork and engagement. One day per week, you’ll have the flexibility to work remotely.
   

  






 Please note this position is offered on a local contract, therefore you should have the legal right to work in Sweden before applying. Other candidates are welcome to register their interest, and we will keep you in mind for future opportunities.
   

  






**WHO WE ARE**




**& Other Stories** 
 is a modern fashion brand that tells expressive stories. Designed for everyday living – with its excitement, curiosity and imperfections – our clothes empower those who think differently. Learn more about & Other Stories here.
   

  





**WHY YOU’LL LOVE WORKING HERE**




 We offer all our employees attractive benefits with broad development opportunities. All our employees receive a staff discount usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online. In addition to our staff discount, all our employees are included in our H&M Incentive Program – HIP.
   

  





 Brand-based colleagues also receive:
   

  




* 30 days holiday
* A collective agreement which includes pension and life insurance
* Wellness benefit 3000kr/year
* Benify Benefits Portal



**JOIN US**




 Our uniqueness comes from a combination of many things – our inclusive and collaborative culture, our strong values, and opportunities for growth. But most of all, it’s our people who make us who we are.
   

  





 We are committed to a recruitment process that is fair, equitable, and based on competency. We therefore
 
**kindly ask you to not attach a cover letter in your application.**





 To ensure we provide an insightful experience to our candidates, and we support their understanding of the role scope and responsibilities, we use an online assessment method for skills-based recruitment. You will need to complete it as part of the application and screening process.

title: Product Designer, Fixed-Term Contract
description:
*We are Strawberry. With over 245 hotels, 120 restaurants, 20 spas and more, we create thousands of experiences every day. With urban Comfort Hotel®, warm Quality Hotel™, stylish Clarion Hotel® and cosy Home Hotel and more than 40 unique independent hotels, our guests can pick and choose. Our team of 20,000 passionate individuals from more than 120 countries is what makes us grow! Strawberry is built on our core values: energy, courage and enthusiasm.*
 If you are passionate about the hospitality industry and looking to join a team devoted to reshaping the digital customer journey experience, then this is the perfect opportunity for you!
   

  

 At Strawberry, we're not just a hotel company - we're building a universe of experiences. We're transforming the hospitality landscape through innovation and technology. With our wide portfolio, including everything from hotels/rooms to restaurants, spas, experiences, events, and much more, our commercial opportunities are huge!
   

  

**About The Role**
 We’re now looking for a Product Designer to join our Commercial team and take our guest obsession to the next level! This is a one-year fixed-term contract with start in January 2026.
   

  

 At Strawberry, we are striving to create the best experience for our guests! We are covering the complete customer journey; when they are exploring our services and making a booking, during their stay and after they’ve checked out. You will be working closely with product managers and in a cross functional team to deliver excellent user experience for all of our features in both web and app.
   

  

 As part of the design team, you’ll be responsible for the whole design process from the early stage of exploration to user research, concept ideas and user testing and deliver high end prototypes ready to be implemented by developers. Take a user centered approach, create prototypes and wireframes for native apps and web, with the ability to iterate design solutions rapidly and also conduct usability testing.
   

  

**Who we think you are:**
 For this role we are looking for someone with at least 5 years of experience within Product Design. We believe that you are comfortable with different design methodologies and know when to use what depending on the situation at hand. You have experience of conducting research and testing and should be comfortable designing for both app and web because we work in cross functional teams to ensure the best user experience for our guests. We are designing and maintaining our design system in Figma. So you should have previous experience from the tool.
   

  

 We believe you have an education in UX, interactive design or similar and that you have worked in a fast moving business where you had to take your own responsibility to make things happen.
   

  

 We believe that you are a great team player that likes to have fun with your colleagues and inspire others. To thrive here you have the ability to collaborate with other designers & product teams in a rapidly changing environment. We do believe you have strong communication skills to collaborate with various stakeholders. Like challenging others' common perception of how our guests perceive our products and discussing design solutions. We believe that you are detail oriented and a critical thinker, but with a positive “we can do it” attitude. You have an aptitude for problem solving and logical thinking and constantly have an eye on the next innovation and the latest trends.
   

  

**What we can offer you:**
* A truly unique opportunity to shape the future of the guest experiences in hospitality
* A flat organization with trust and autonomy that goes the extra mile, and cares about both people and the environment.
* Exceptional colleagues and an inclusive, experimentation-based, and innovative culture - we love to share and learn from each other, and test ideas if they work
* Great benefits! In addition to our collective agreement, we also offer staff discounts and friends & family rates at our 250+ hotels!
* A vibrant office in Solna, with a hybrid setup with 3 days a week in the office.


**Sounds interesting?**
 Great - because we would love to get to know you too! Submit your application below and let us tell you more.
   

  

 Please note that this is a one-year project-based contract with start in January, and we are only considering applicants who are currently residing in Sweden, preferably in the Stockholm area.
   

  

 And one more important thing: We only review applications that include a portfolio, so please make sure to attach both your CV and portfolio that demonstrates your design process when applying.

title: Assistant Art Director
description:
**Job Description**

 As an
 **Assistant Art Director** 
 you will support the Art Director in developing and executing creative concepts across campaigns and brand touchpoints, contributing to visual storytelling and ensuring consistency and excellence in creative output.
   

  





**WHAT YOU’LL DO**



* Assist in the development of visual concepts and layouts for creative projects across all channels.
* Support and facilitate Art Directors in 360 campaign documentation and execution, including crop references and formats.
* Ensure all creative work aligns with & Other Stories’ brand visual expression.
* Collaborate with Art Directors and Production Managers to ensure timely processes and delivery.
* Organize and maintain visual assets and references for ongoing and future projects.
* Stay updated on visual trends, fashion movements, and cultural references to inspire creative work.
* Incorporate feedback from senior creatives and stakeholders to refine deliverables.
* Assist Art Directors in preparing presentations and decks for internal reviews and external partners.

 You will collaborate closely with Art Directors, Production Managers, and other creative team members to deliver high-quality visual content across campaigns and brand touchpoints.

* Strong eye for image composition, typography, and coherent execution.

title: Frontend Engineer
description:
**About Sana**
 Sana is an AI lab building superintelligence for work.
   

  

 We believe organizations can accomplish their missions faster when humans can effortlessly access knowledge, automate repetitive work, and learn anything with the help of agentic AI.
   

  

 As part of Workday, we are committed to building AI that augments humans.
   

  

 If that’s a mission that excites you, you’re in the right place.
   

  

**About The Role**
 In this role, you’ll create engaging user experiences while implementing robust frontend application logic. You'll work closely with our engineering and design teams to build and maintain our user interfaces, focusing on both visual implementation and technical architecture.
   

  

**In this role, you will:**
* Build engaging user interfaces with a focus on both functionality and experience
* Work with engineering teams to implement frontend application logic
* Collaborate with Product Design to deliver high-quality implementations
* Develop and maintain core frontend infrastructure


**Your background looks something like:**
* Proficiency in technologies like TypeScript, React, styled-components, framer motion, and custom CSS implementations
* Experience building complex UI components and systems
* Familiarity with Radix UI and similar component libraries
* Strong understanding of web fundamentals, from HTTP to CSS
* Focus on writing maintainable, scalable frontend code


****What we offer****
* Help shape AI's future alongside brilliant minds from Notion, Dropbox, Slack, Databricks, Google, McKinsey, and BCG.
* Competitive salary complemented with a transparent and highly competitive options program.
* Swift professional growth in an evolving environment, supported by a culture of continuous feedback and mentorship from senior leaders.
* Work with talented teammates across 5+ countries, and collaborate with customers globally
* Regular team gatherings and events (recently in Italy and South Africa)

title: Webbredaktör
description:
Till sektionen Kommunikation och Engagemang vid Försvarsstabens kommunikationsavdelning söker vi nu en driven skribent för rollen som webbredaktör. Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
   

  

**Om arbetsplatsen** 
 Sektionen Kommunikation och engagemang ansvarar för avdelningens leveranser inom marknads- och relationskommunikation i attraherande och rekryterande syfte. Här ingår till exempel kampanjer, event, CRM och kandidatsupport. Utöver detta ansvarar sektionen även för planering, produktion, utveckling och uppföljning av Försvarsmaktens centrala externa och interna kanaler. Här ingår även den försvarsmaktsgemensamma redaktionella planeringen som en viktig del.
   

  

**Om rollen** 
 Som webbredaktör ansvarar du för att driva utvecklingen av vår webbplats och säkerställa att den är aktuell, engagerande och optimerad för våra målgrupper. I rollen ingår att planera, producera, redigera och publicera innehåll på webbplatsen. Du skriver och optimerar webbtexter, bygger kampanjsidor och utvecklar nya sidor efter verksamhetens behov. Du arbetar aktivt med SEO för att stärka synlighet och räckvidd.
   

  

 Du har löpande kontakt med interna informationsägare för att säkerställa att innehållet är korrekt, relevant och följer organisationens riktlinjer. Du ansvarar också för att webbplatsen uppfyller gällande krav på tillgänglighet.
   

  

 Du arbetar nära kollegorna på sektionen men kommer också delta i projektgrupper inom avdelningen och bidra med webbkompetens i olika kommunikationsprojekt.
   

  

**KRAV**
**Kvalifikationer**
* En för tjänsten relevant eftergymnasial utbildning
* Flerårig aktuell och relevant erfarenhet av liknande arbetsuppgifter inom en större komplex organisation
* Aktuell och relevant erfarenhet av arbete med SEO
* Aktuell och relevant erfarenhet av arbete med att följa upp webbstatistik och användarbeteenden
* Goda kunskaper om tillgänglighetsdirektivet (WCAG)
* Goda kunskaper i Optimizely
* Goda kunskaper i Sharepoint
* Goda kunskaper i Adobe Photoshop
* God förmåga att kommunicera på svenska i såväl tal som skrift


**Personliga egenskaper** 
 Vi söker dig som är en strukturerad och driven skribent, som trivs i en miljö som kräver självständighet men också nära samarbete med andra. Du har lätt för att skapa och utveckla goda relationer. Du är analytisk och sätter dig snabbt in i komplexa frågor och omvandlar dem till tydliga, tillgängliga och välformulerade texter. Stor vikt kommer att läggas vid personlig lämplighet.
   

  

**Meriterande**
* Erfarenhet av Google Analytics
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta i en DAM - Digital Asset Management System
* Aktuell erfarenhet av arbete som copywriter
* Kunskaper inom UX-design
* Relevant erfarenhet från Försvarsmakten


 För att myndighetens uppdrag ska vara framgångsrikt förutsätts att alla medarbetare uppträder enligt Försvarsmaktens värdegrund. Försvarsmaktens värdegrund slår vakt om alla människors lika värde, rättvisa och jämlikhet och främjar demokrati och mänskliga rättigheter (läs mer på www.forsvarsmakten.se).
   

  

**Övrigt** 
 Befattningen är civil och är placerad på Högkvarteret i Stockholm. Som anställd i Försvarsmakten ingår deltagande i övningar, beredskapstjänstgöring och kan innebära deltagande i nationella och internationella insatser.
   

  

 Anställningsort: Stockholm
   

  

 Tillträde: Enligt överenskommelse
   

  

 Anställningsform: Tillsvidareanställning på heltid som inleds med 6 månaders provanställning för sökande som idag inte är anställda inom Försvarsmakten.
   

  

 Tester kan komma att genomföras under rekryteringsprocessen.
   

  

**Kontaktpersoner** 
 Vid frågor om tjänsten kontakta rekryterande chef Anna Nilheimer, för frågor om rekryteringsprocessen kontakta HR-specialist Agneta Lund.
   

  

**Fackliga representanter** 
 SACO: Stefan Ungerth
   

  

 SEKO: Monika Danielsson/Liselott Larsson
   

  

 Försvarsförbundet, OFRS: Kjell Tetzlaff/ Rikard Amcoff
   

  

 OFRO: Roger Ericsson
   

  

**Samtliga nås via växeln på 08-788 75 00**
**Ansökan** 
 Låter detta som en spännande möjlighet för dig? Välkommen med din ansökan så snart som möjligt, dock senast den 8 december 2025. Din ansökan ska innehålla CV och ansökningsbrev samt svar på angivna urvalsfrågor.
   

  

 ,
 **Ansökningar till denna befattning kommer endast tas emot via Försvarsmaktens webbplats.** 
 ----------------------------------------------------- Information om det rekryterande förbandet: I Högkvarteret finns överbefälhavaren och generaldirektören. Högkvarteret har ungefär 1 000 medarbetare – både yrkesofficerare och civila experter. Högkvarteret utgörs från 2023-01-01 av försvarsstaben, operationsledningen, militära underrättelse- och säkerhetstjänsten, samt Högkvarterets stabsavdelning och fristående enheter för tillsyn. En anställning hos oss innebär placering i säkerhetsklass. Vanligtvis krävs svenskt medborgarskap. Säkerhetsprövning med registerkontroll kommer att genomföras före anställning enligt 3 kap i säkerhetsskyddslagen. Med anställning följer en skyldighet att krigsplaceras. I anställningen ingår även en skyldighet att tjänstgöra utomlands. Innebörden av detta varierar beroende på typ av befattning. Till ansökan om anställning ska CV och personligt brev bifogas. Om du går vidare i anställningsprocessen ska alltid vidimerade kopior av betyg och intyg uppvisas. Samtal från externa rekryteringsföretag och säljare undanbedes.

title: Visiting Faculty Researcher, Human Centered AI
description:
**Minimum qualifications:**
* PhD degree in Human Factors, Psychology, Human Computer Interaction, Cognitive Science, Computer Science, Information Science, a related field or equivalent practical experience.
* 5 years of experience conducting qualitative research with strengths and shortcomings of different methods, including their application during each product phases like interviews, usability testing, diary studies, contextual inquiries, surveys, benchmarking.
* Experience in contributing to research communities or efforts, including publishing papers at academic conferences (e.g., CHI, UIST, NIPS, ICML, ACL, CVPR, etc).


**Preferred qualifications:**
* Experience in addressing misinformation in technology or in academics.
* Experience in Human Computer Interaction.
* Experience in using Generative AI products.


**About the job** 
 At Google, research-focused Software Engineers are embedded throughout the company, allowing them to setup large-scale tests and deploy promising ideas quickly and broadly. Ideas may come from internal projects as well as from collaborations with research programs at partner universities and technical institutes all over the world.
   

  

 From creating experiments and prototyping implementations to designing new architectures, engineers work on real-world problems including artificial intelligence, data mining, natural language processing, hardware and software performance analysis, improving compilers for mobile platforms, as well as core search and much more. But you stay connected to your research roots as an active contributor to the wider research community by partnering with universities and publishing papers.
   

  

 In this role, you will have the opportunity to explore projects at industrial scale, work with technology, and experience Google culture. You will return to the universities with new research directions and educational ideas. You will collaborate on a project proposal that includes expected outcomes and results.Google Research addresses challenges that define the technology of today and tomorrow. From conducting fundamental research to influencing product development, our research teams have the opportunity to impact technology used by billions of people every day.
   

  

 Our teams aspire to make discoveries that impact everyone, and core to our approach is sharing our research and tools to fuel progress in the field -- we publish regularly in academic journals, release projects as open source, and apply research to Google products.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Conduct qualitative research (e.g., interviews, workshops) on topics related to responsible Artificial Intelligence (AI).
* Develop design and evaluation guidance for responsible AI systems.
* Work with vulnerable populations and community-based organizations, and design study protocols to comply with related human subjects and data ethics standards.


 Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form .

title: Senior Product Designer
description:
**About Us**
 Legora is on a mission: to redefine how legal work gets done. From the very start we have been very clear about the fact that we are not building a solution for lawyers, we are building it with them, because it is the only way to make sure it gets done the right way; working side-by-side every step of the way.
   

  

 Our AI-native workspace empowers legal professionals not just to work faster - but to ask better questions, unlock new insights. Every day, we push the boundaries of legal tech to make complex processes smarter, faster, and more human. From thousands of documents analysed in minutes to intelligent workflows designed in collaboration with leading practices, we’re turning possibility into reality.
   

  

 Today we are trusted by global firms like Cleary Gottlieb, Goodwin, Bird & Bird and Linklaters in over 40 countries, but we have no plans on stopping here. We ship fast, we iterate effectively, and we scale rapidly - not by accident, but by design.
   

  

 When you join Legora, you become part of a team that believes "good enough" isn’t good enough and that the way to win is together, by empowering lawyers to do their best work with technology that truly understands them. If you’re excited by building from first principles, working with exceptional people, and accelerating change in a high-stakes, high-impact domain—then this is the moment and the place.
   

  

**We’re not just shaping the future of legal tech — we’re defining it. Ready to join us in building the intelligent future of law?**
**The role**
 We’re hiring a Senior Product Designer to shape the core experience of the most intuitive legal platform in the world. You’ll work end-to-end—exploring ideas, crafting clear interfaces, and refining details in close collaboration with engineers. The role is execution-first: your strength lies in turning complex workflows into simple, powerful interfaces, especially as we design new patterns for working with AI.
   

  

**What You Will Be Doing**
* Design user flows, interactions, and interfaces for AI-powered tools
* Turn ambiguous problems into concrete, high-quality product experiences
* Work hands-on with engineers to bring your designs to life
* Use Figma to design, document, and iterate with speed
* Contribute to—and help scale—our design system
* Push for clarity, consistency, and quality in every corner of the product


**Who You Are**
* Strong experience designing digital products end-to-end
* A portfolio that shows clear thinking, elegant UI, and shipped product work
* Sharp visual skills and attention to detail
* Curiosity about how AI changes user behavior and interfaces
* Pragmatism and a bias toward shipping over theorizing


**Legora is an Equal Opportunity Employer**
 At Legora, we believe great teams are built on diversity of thought and experience. We’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer and committed to creating an inclusive, high-performance culture where everyone can do their best work. We welcome people of all backgrounds and don’t discriminate based on race, color, religion, national origin, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, disability, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

 Legora is on a mission: to redefine how legal work gets done. From the very start we have been very clear about the fact that we are not building a solution for lawyers, we are building it with them, because it is the only way to make sure it gets done the right way; working side-by-side every step of the way.
   

  

 Our AI-native workspace empowers legal professionals not just to work faster - but to ask better questions, unlock new insights.  You’ll partner directly with leadership in design, product, and engineering to define where we’re going, while still rolling up your sleeves to deliver best-in-class interaction and visual design. This is a role for a designer who thrives on solving hard problems and multiplying the impact of the whole team.
   

  

**What You Will Be Doing**
* Lead design across multiple product areas, ensuring coherence and clarity at the system level.
* Shape product strategy: frame the hardest problems, influence roadmaps, and push for bold but practical solutions.
* Set and evolve the quality bar for design craft, accessibility, and usability across Legora’s product.
* Partner with engineering and product leadership to make tradeoffs that preserve experience while shipping fast.
* Explore entirely new product directions, from zero-to-one ideas to scaled launches.


**Who You Are**

* Exceptional craft in interaction and visual design, combined with the ability to connect details to strategy.
* Comfortable working in complex domains and navigating ambiguous problem spaces.
* Skilled at moving seamlessly between hands-on design and high-level product thinking.

 At Legora, we believe great teams are built on diversity of thought and experience.
