title: Senior QA Engineer / Test Automation Specialist – SportAdmin
description:
Applications are considered on a rolling basis Malmö On-site
  
  

About SportAdmin
  
  

SportAdmin is part of Lime Technologies, one of Sweden’s most loved SaaS companies. We build solutions that make life easier for sports clubs and associations. Our products are trusted by 150,000 users every single day – including our popular SportAdmin App. We’re passionate about creating tools that empower communities and simplify administration.
  
  

The Role
  
  

We are looking for an experienced Senior QA Engineer / Test Automation Specialist to join us on an exciting journey: Moving from a manual testing process to building a modern test automation platform that makes it easy to build, ship, and run services quickly, securely, and reliably. You will play a key role in shaping our testing strategy and building the foundation that ensures quality across our products.
  
  

What it’s like to work here
  
  

At SportAdmin, we believe testers are more than bug hunters – they are quality advocates and problem solvers. You’ll work closely with developers and product teams to design pragmatic solutions, automate where it matters most, and make testing an integral part of our development process. We encourage experimentation, long-term thinking, and writing clean, maintainable test code. You’ll have the freedom to influence architecture and testing practices while enjoying a collaborative and fun work environment.
  
  

Your Mission
  
  

* Lead the transition from manual testing to automated testing.
* Build and maintain a test automation platform that accelerates development and improves reliability.
* Collaborate with developers to integrate testing into CI/CD pipelines.
* Ensure our products meet the highest standards of quality and performance.


What we’re looking for
  
  

* Strong experience in test automation frameworks and tools.
* Knowledge of CI/CD pipelines (GitHub Actions, Octopus Cloud).
* Familiarity with cloud environments (AWS preferred).
* Ability to design and implement scalable test strategies for complex SaaS products.
* A mindset focused on quality, speed, and reliability.


Perks & Benefits
  
  

* Flexible working hours and hybrid work options.
* Generous wellness allowance and health benefits.
* Fun team activities and company events.
* Modern office in central Malmö.
* The culture and perks of being part of Lime Technologies – including Lime Camp, hackathons, and a strong focus on personal growth.


Location
  
  

Malmö, Sweden (Hybrid work possible)
  
  

Ready to apply?
  
  

If this sounds like you, apply today and help us build the future of testing at SportAdmin!
  
  

About the company
  
  

Making it easier for kids and young people to thrive in association life by reducing administrative burdens for organizations. We help clubs focus on what matters – creating meaningful activities and experiences.
  
  

Want to make a difference? Join us and contribute today!
  
  

Felicia Oor | Contact Person
company_description: Looking for a boring employer? Look elsewhere! At Lime, we love customer care, sales and case management! We love to deliver that “something special” – while having a lot of fun along the way.

title: Konsultuppdrag | Engineering Manager to Data & Analytics Engineering
description:
**Location:** Stockholm, Oslo Hybrid

**Start:** 2026-01-05 - 2026-12-31

 **Workload:** 100 %.

 **Seniority level:** 5+ years

**About the role:**


Data & Analytics Engineering consists of established subgroups with dedicated focuses on backend, frontend, and data management within data engineering. In this role, you will be the Engineering Manager for one of our subgroups and play a pivotal leadership role in further strengthening the data personnel and data technology aspects within Data & Analytics Engineering.


As the Engineering Manager, your focus will be on leading a team and data-related projects to enhance data capabilities, establishing new solutions, leading migration projects on cloud data platforms, and manage the organization's vital asset – data.

**Main tasks:**

* Leadership responsibility for managing **one of the teams** within our Data & Analytics Engineering functions. The team consists of eight team members located in both Stockholm & Oslo. The team consists of Data Engineers and Data Quality Engineers.
* Overseeing and owning data-related solutions, migrations, and projects within the data management area.
* Ensuring the effective utilization of data in data assets.
* Partial product ownership for planning, prioritization, and execution of your area's data projects.
* Technical oversight of your area's data solutions and guidance for stakeholders and your team.
* Providing strong technical leadership within data engineering, including guiding and ensuring best practices in development, migrations, and deployment, and leading technical implementations and rollouts of data solutions.

**We are looking for you who:**

* A bachelor's or master's degree in computer science, data science, engineering, or a related field is required.
* Work experience of a minimum of 5 years in data engineering or a related field, with at least 2 years in a leadership or management role.
* Strong leadership and team management skills, with the ability to inspire, mentor, and lead a team of data professionals.
* Demonstrated technical leadership within data engineering, with experience leading deployments and driving the adoption of modern data engineering practices.
* Data engineering expertise, in-depth knowledge of data engineering and analytics principles, tools, and technologies, including data warehousing, ETL processes, data modeling, and data visualization.
* Project and product management skills, including data-related project planning with roadmaps, execution, and successful delivery.

**It's plus if you have:**


Hands-on experience with the following tools and technologies: Microsoft Azure, Databricks, DBT, Python, or similar.

**To thrive and perform well in the role, we believe that you need to be:**


You thrive in a fast-paced, evolving environment and stay adaptable as priorities shift. You’re energized by leading and developing people, building collaborative teams that deliver results. Tackling complex data challenges motivates you, and you approach them with curiosity and a solution-oriented mindset. You value learning, collaboration, and driving initiatives that strengthen our shared data platform.

 **Om oss**

*Senterprise är ett ledande rekryteringsbolag inom IT och en oberoende förmedlare av frilansande konsulter. Med aktiv headhunting, search och djup teknisk förståelse hjälper vi några av Sveriges främsta arbetsgivare att hitta rätt kandidater, både för anställning och konsultuppdrag.*

*Läs vidare på* *www.senterprise.se*

title: Experienced professionals to our Banking & Financial Services Engineering Team
description:
We are seeking a skilled engineer with 2–4 years of experience to join our Banking & Financial Services Engineering team in Stockholm. You will work in Agile delivery set-ups, collaborating closely with product owners, business experts, and technology specialists to deliver high-value solutions for our clients.


This role is ideal for candidates with both technical expertise and experience in product management roles (e.g. Product Owner, Scrum Master or Cloud Engineers) within core banking services and applications.


**What You’ll Do**

* Build, test, and implement technology solutions for leading banks and financial institutions.
* Work in Agile delivery teams, supporting iterative development and continuous improvement.
* Drive transformation projects in core banking, payments, cards, lending, compliance, and risk management.
* Collaborate across Deloitte’s Swedish and global practices to deliver future-proofed solutions.
* Act as a bridge between business and technology, contributing to product roadmaps and delivery.
* Ensure that technical solutions meet business needs as well as security and regulatory requirements.
**Qualifications**
------------------

* 2–4 years of experience in software engineering, technology consulting, or systems implementation.
* Prior experience as a Product Owner, Scrum Master or Engineering roles within core banking services/applications is highly valued.
* Background in banking / financial services projects (core banking systems, payments, risk, compliance, or similar).
* Hands-on experience with Agile methodologies (Scrum, SAFe, Kanban).
* Proficiency in one or more programming languages (Java, .NET, Python, etc.).
* Knowledge of APIs, microservices, and/or cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP) is a plus.
* Strong analytical and communication skills with the ability to work in dynamic, collaborative teams.
* Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or equivalent.
* Fluent in English; Swedish language skills are a strong advantage.

**What We Offer**

* The opportunity to work with Sweden’s largest financial services clients in Agile delivery set-ups.
* A collaborative and inclusive workplace at our Stockholm office, with hybrid flexibility.
* Continuous learning and professional development, including certifications in Agile, cloud, and financial services.
* Competitive compensation and benefits tailored to the Swedish market.
Clear career growth opportunities within Deloitte’s Financial Services and Engineering practices.  
* 

**Ready to Make an Impact?**

If you’re passionate about engineering, Agile delivery, and product ownership within banking, Deloitte Sweden offers the platform to accelerate your career and shape the future of financial services.


**Additional Information**
--------------------------

**How to Apply:**

You apply online. Your application should consist of:


* CV
* Letter of motivation
	+ Why you are interested in Deloitte and the role as a consultant
	+ What you think you can contribute with and bring to the role

**Please submit your application as soon as possible, as we work with ongoing selection.**  

  

*As a qualitative part of Deloitte's recruitment process, our final candidates undergo a background check, to increase awareness of our future employees, secure the working environment for our employees and meet regulatory requirements. The background check process is carried out in collaboration with ToFindOut.* *https://tofindout.se/en/background-check/*  

  

**Questions?**

If you have any questions regarding the role or the application process, please contact Anna Taube, Manager Talent Acquisition, at ataube@deloitte.se .
  

  

**We are looking forward to your application!**  

  

For further information on Deloitte, please visit www.deloitte.se


**What impact will you make?**

Every day, your work will make an impact that matters, while you thrive in a dynamic culture of inclusion, collaboration and high performance. We do not just aspire to make solutions. We wish to create an impact that makes a positive and crucial difference for the people around us, our clients and our society. Deloitte is where you’ll find unlimited opportunities to succeed and realize your full potential.


**Job Location**
----------------

Your background may include roles such as claims handler, IT business analyst, system implementation specialist, or similar positions within insurance. Experience in project management, test management, product management, or software development is highly valued. While not mandatory, familiarity with AI and cloud technologies is considered an advantage.

title: Business Development Representative (Swedish speaking)
description:
**Xensam:** Join the Future of SAM Xensam is the leader in AI-powered, cloud-based Software Asset Management. Our technology brings clarity to complex IT environments, helping users make smart, data-driven decisions and maximize software ROI.
  
Recognized with the Highest Growth Award and ranked #3 Overall Champion at the Main Software 50 Awards Nordics, we’re scaling fast and looking for people who want to join the journey. At Xensam, you play a key role in a team built on energy, focus, and positivity. We value experience, but even more, the person behind it.
  
Together, we build the future of SAM.
  
About the role
  
As a Business Development Representative, you will play a crucial role in expanding Xensam's global footprint. Your primary responsibility will be to identify and engage with potential clients, initiating the sales process and building valuable relationships. You'll work closely with the Sales Team and Marketing team to execute effective outreach strategies and foster meaningful connections with prospects. Responsibilities
  
Conducting extensive market research to identify new leads and target industries for IT asset management solutions
  
Initiate and maintain regular communication with prospective customers to understand their needs, educate them about our products or services, and promote the value proposition of our solutions
  
Conduct proactive outbound prospecting activities, such as cold calling, email campaigns, and social media outreach, to identify potential customers and generate sales leads
  
Qualify leads based on established criteria to determine their fit and potential as a prospective client
  
Delivering on KPI and sales quota
  
Build and nurture relationships with key stakeholders, decision-makers, and influencers within target accounts
  
Maintain accurate and up-to-date records of all sales activities, customer interactions, and prospect information in the CRM system
  
Track and manage sales leads, opportunities, and follow-up activities to ensure a steady flow of qualified prospects and progress through the sales pipeline
  
Collaborate with colleagues and sales team to identify and address any potential roadblocks or challenges in the sales process and share best practices and sales techniques to enhance team performance
  
Provide feedback and insights from customer interactions to help refine marketing strategies, product development, and customer service initiatives
  
  

Qualifications
  
A passion for sales and a hunger to succeed in a fast-paced and competitive environment
  
Prior experience in sales, customer service, or business development is a plus, but not a strict requirement
  
Excellent communication skills and the ability to articulate Xensam's value proposition convincingly
  
Strong problem-solving skills, a keen eye for detail, and a customer-centric mindset
  
Self-motivated and target-oriented, with a demonstrated ability to meet or exceed sales goals
  
Excellent organizational and time management skills, with the ability to prioritize tasks and manage a high volume of leads and prospecting lists
  
Adaptability and willingness to learn about the industry and market trends
  
Fluency in both written and spoken English and Swedish.
  
  

What you get
  
A generous work culture with free drinks and snacks, office massages, and more.
  
Three days in-office (with remote work on Mondays and Fridays).
  
An opportunity to shape your career growth while contributing to the company’s success.
  
A dynamic position embracing "freedom under responsibility".
  
If sales targets are met, all employees enjoy an annual destination trip.
  
Other location-specific benefits.
  
  

Our values at Xensam
  
Rebellious We challenge the norm and act with initiative – always with responsibility.
  
Humane We foster a caring, inclusive environment that values diversity and respects individuality.
  
Harmony We value balance and create a supportive workplace where people thrive.
  
As part of our recruitment process, we conduct background checks on final candidates to fulfill our commitments to customers and ensure a safe work environment

title: R&D Software Manager
description:
**R&D Software Manager – ASSA ABLOY Global Solutions Hospitality**

**Location: Stockholm, Sweden**
**Open the door to innovation and leadership**  

We’re looking for an experienced **RnD Line Manager** who can inspire, guide, and coach our development teams to deliver world-class solutions for the Hospitality industry. In this role, you’ll lead agile, cross-functional teams working on cloud and firmware products, shaping the future of access control technology.

**What you’ll do**
* Lead and develop a high-performing team of engineers based in Stockholm
* Drive software and firmware development with a strong focus on quality, security, and customer relevance
* Manage budgets and ensure timely delivery of projects aligned with specifications and milestones
* Motivate and engage teams, fostering creativity and collaboration
* Promote a results-driven culture and continuous improvement
* Oversee product certifications and compliance processes
* Act as a key link between Product Development and R&D

**What you bring**
* Strong leadership skills and experience managing highly skilled engineers
* Hands-on understanding of software and embedded systems
* Proven track record in Agile methodologies and project management
* Excellent communication skills across all organizational levels
* Minimum 5 years of relevant experience and a Master’s degree in Engineering (or equivalent)
* Commercial awareness and ability to adapt to changing business needs

**Why Join Us**

At ASSA ABLOY Global Solutions, you’ll be part of a global leader in access solutions, shaping the future of secure and connected experiences. Joining us means:
* **Impactful Work** – Your leadership will directly influence cutting-edge products used by millions worldwide in the hospitality industry
* **Innovation at Scale** – Work with advanced technologies in cloud, IoT, and embedded systems, driving solutions that set industry standards
* **Global Collaboration** – Engage with talented teams across multiple countries, sharing knowledge and building solutions together
* **Career Growth** – We invest in your development through training, leadership programs, and opportunities to grow within a global organization
* **Inclusive Culture** – Be part of a diverse, supportive environment where creativity and collaboration thrive


Interested? Apply now to join a team where innovation meets impact.

For more information, feel free to reach out to our **Senior Talent Acquisition Business Partner, Jamal Klasen**, at **jamal.klasen@assaabloy.com**.  


**We are the ASSA ABLOY Group**  

Our people have made us the global leader in access solutions. In return, we open doors for them wherever they go. With nearly 63,000 colleagues in more than 70 different countries, we help billions of people experience a more open world. Our innovations make all sorts of spaces – physical and virtual – safer, more secure, and easier to access.
As an employer, we value results – not titles, or backgrounds. We empower our people to build their career around their aspirations and our ambitions – supporting them with regular feedback, training, and development opportunities. Our colleagues think broadly about where they can make the most impact, and we encourage them to grow their role locally, regionally, or even internationally.
As we welcome new people on board, it’s important to us to have diverse, inclusive teams, and we value different perspectives and experiences.
company_description: Let’s create a safer and more open world – together!

title: Tech Lead – Frontend
description:
Vi har nu ett nytt behov och söker därför en konsultkollega med nedan kvalifikationer. Tjänsten är en del av vår konsultverksamhet vilket innebär att du blir anställd av oss och arbetar hos kund alt. interna projekt och åtaganden.

 **Din profil (Skall krav)**  

* Har minst 5 års erfarenhet av utveckling i JavaScript/TypeScript eller liknande
* Har arbetat med React och React Native
* Har erfarenhet av microservices och molnplattform (gärna Google Cloud)
* Är van vid CI/CD, terraform, API-integrationer och eventdriven arkitektur
* Har god förståelse för hur man bygger och skalar produkter
* Kommunicerar väl på svenska och engelska

  

**Sista ansökningdatum:** 01-12-2025 **Om Oss**  

Att jobba på Deploja är något helt annat än att arbeta på ett vanligt konsultbolag – och det är vi riktigt stolta över. Vad är det då som gör oss unika?

  

Vi erbjuder helt enkelt mer än bara hög lön och större frihet, det är bara början. Hos oss hittar du den arbetsmiljö och de möjligheter du förtjänar. Här påverkar du din egen lön som helt och hållet som baseras på ditt timpris mot kund.


Vår lönemodell är en hybridlösning mellan en fast månadslön och en provisionsbaserad ersättning. Det innebär att din månadslön baseras på ditt timpris, fast om du mot förmodan skulle stå utan uppdrag så behåller du en grund lön fram tills vi hittat ett nytt uppdrag, bra va?

 **Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**


Spännande uppdrag hos våra många kunder. Vi fokuserar på långsiktiga uppdrag, vilket ger dig möjlighet att skapa värde för kunden samtidigt som du utvecklas själv.


En trygg månadslön – tillsammans bestämmer vi en grundlön baserad på dina uppdrag.


Tjänstebil – vi uppmuntrar dig att välja en elbil för en mer hållbar framtid.


Tjänstepension och stora möjligheter till löneväxling.


Semester - Önskar du mer än 30 dagar semester, kanske 60 dagar?


Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring, olycksfallsförsäkring och livförsäkring för ökad trygghet.

  

Kompetensutveckling – du får själv sätta din budget och välja vilka utbildningar du vill delta i.


Livskvalitet - Har du kanske svårt att få ihop pusslet i vardagen och önskar arbeta lite mindre och ändå kunna tjäna lika mycket om inte mer?  

  

*Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande, med hänsyn till höga arbetstrycket är det extra viktigt med en kort motivering för tjänsten som förklarar hur man möter kraven.*

title: CFO till vårt Sweefgäng
description:
Vi på Sweef har ett episkt uppdrag som går ut på att utveckla och sälja Sveriges skönaste möbler. Vi är mycket noga med vårt sortiment och säljer endast det vi själva har slappat i för att försäkra oss om att möblerna verkligen förtjänar titeln Sveriges skönaste. Glädjande nog har arbetet lönat sig och som nästa steg söker vi nu en ny stjärna till vårt team.


För dig som brinner för ekonomi i en ledande roll med stort ansvar innebär det en chans att komma in i ett snabbt växande företag som mutat in ett passionerat revir i möbelbranschen. I denna roll hos Sweef kommer du att ha ett övergripande ansvar för att vidare bygga, leda och utveckla en automatiserad, datadriven och skalbar ekonomifunktion som i dagsläget spänner över tre marknader.


Om tjänsten


Som CFO kommer du att ha en nyckelroll inom Sweef, där du tillsammans med VD och övriga i ledningen ansvarar för exekvering av bolagets långsiktiga strategi och tillväxt. Du kommer få ett helhetsansvar för att leda och driva de ekonomiska processerna för tre legala enheter, Sweef, Happy Fluffy Cloud och Nufferton, och dotterbolag i Norge respektive Tyskland. Tillsammans med två kollegor, ansvarar du för finansiell styrning och kontroll, budget och prognos, samt årsredovisning och löpande bokföring. Tjänsten är placerad på vårt showroom/kontor som ligger centralt på Drottninggatan 75 i Stockholm.


Exempel på ansvarsområden och arbetsuppgifter

* Driva och ha det övergripande ansvaret för företagets ekonomistyrning och fungera som ett finansiellt affärsstöd till VD och nyckelrollsinnehavare vid såväl strategiska som operativa beslut
* Helhetsansvar för business controlling, årsredovisning, löpande bokföring och bokslut, inkl. KPI- och finansiell rapportering till styrelse
* Arbeta nära tillsammans med övriga personer inom ekonomi på Sweef, dvs inte vara främmande för att jobba hands-on i den vardagliga driften och utveckla ekonomifunktionen
* Säkerställa att bolaget har adekvata system och supportfunktioner för att kunna hantera tilltänkt tillväxt
* Ansvar för externa kontakter med revisorer, bank och andra finansiella intressenter
* Ansvar för att bolaget följer gällande lagar och regler, samt att rapportering är korrekt och i tid till styrelsen




Sweef har en stark kultur som grundar sig i det som är vår kärna, nämligen kunden och försäljning. Som person är du ansvarstagande, har ett strålande humör och älskar att ta i där det behövs. Du är en utpräglad ”doer” som drivs av att kämpa som ett team och gör alltid ditt bästa. Ingenting lämnas åt slumpen.


Sweef brinner verkligen för våra kunder! Detta gör att vi rycker in där det behövs och stundtals stöttar med allt från kundkontakt till logistik, som en naturlig del av vår vardag


Dina superkrafter:

* Du brinner för att driva verksamheten mot uppsatta mål och som person är du lyhörd, prestigelös, modig och räds inte att hugga tag där det behövs
* Du trivs i en miljö där förändring och utveckling till det bättre är vardag
* Du är en trygg ledare med god kommunikativ förmåga
* Du har en stark förståelse för det kommersiella och har en hög analytisk förmåga, kan dra snabba slutsatser utifrån insikter och sedan ge faktabaserade rekommendationer till ledningen
* Du har Microsoft BC som din hemmabana och brinner för automation och datadrivna beslutsunderlag

  

Det är ett extra plus i kanten (men inget krav på), om du har erfarenhet från:


* Starka varumärken och handel med sällanköpsprodukter
* Bolag i internationell miljö
* Bolag på tillväxtresa
* Företagstransaktioner och integrationsarbete
  


Känns detta som en kusligt klockren beskrivning av dig? Kom och ansök!

title: Identity and Access Management (IAM) Lead
description:
Odevo is a group of exciting brands with a shared vision of challenging status quo in the property management industry. We are committed to revolutionizing the industry with innovative software solutions that make managing properties easier, more efficient, and more effective. Our rapidly growing product and engineering organization now includes around 200 highly skilled professionals.


Our cloud-based platform is unique, and in a brief time, we have proven ourselves as a leading and innovative player on the market. Our product development department acts as a SaaS supplier to all the companies in the Odevo group and several other players in the industry. Together, we will continue to challenge and change this industry. To continue our ambitious growth journey, we seek more great people to join us to build market-leading property management software products. Are you one of them?

**About the role**


Are you ready to take the helm in shaping the future of identity and access management at Odevo? We are on the lookout for a passionate and technically adept IAM Technical Lead who is eager to dive into both strategic leadership and hands-on implementation. This is not just a role; it's an opportunity to make a significant impact on the security and efficiency of our access management systems.


**What You'll Do:**


* **Lead with Vision:** Drive a comprehensive review of our existing IAM processes and tools, setting a strategic direction that aligns with Odevo's ambitious goals.
* **Hands-On Implementation:** Roll up your sleeves and get involved in the technical nitty-gritty. You'll be implementing cutting-edge IAM solutions that enhance our security posture.
* **Innovate and Optimize:** Identify gaps in our current IAM framework and propose innovative solutions that streamline processes and bolster security.
* **Collaborate and Influence:** Work closely with cross-functional teams to ensure seamless integration of IAM strategies across the organization.
* **Mentor and Inspire:** Guide and support Tech staff in all things IAM and improve their understanding of IAM tools and processes.

**What We’re Looking For:**

* A seasoned IAM expert with a strong technical background and a proven track record in implementation.
* A strategic thinker who can see the big picture but also has an eye for detail.
* A proactive problem-solver who thrives in a dynamic environment and is always looking for ways to improve and innovate.
* Experience with migrating existing IAM solutions.
* Excellent communication skills, with the ability to articulate complex technical concepts to diverse audiences.
* Have a thirst for knowledge, keeping up to date with the constantly changing security and IAM landscape
* Good understanding of security certifications, frameworks and regulations (e.g ISO27001, NIST Cyber Framework, NIS2, DORA).

You are fluent in English and it is an added bonus if you know additional languages such as Spanish, Italian, Portuguese, German, Swedish or Finnish.


Join us at Odevo and be at the forefront of transforming our IAM landscape. If you're ready to lead, innovate, and make a real difference, we want to hear from you!


**Key Responsibilities:**


**Be Odevo’s IAM Expert:**

* Be the first point of all for things “IAM”
* Provide guidance and direction on IAM for new projects

**Inventory and Assessment:**


* Conduct a thorough inventory of existing IAM processes, tools, and coverage.
* Evaluate the effectiveness and efficiency of current IAM systems.
* Identify current gaps in IAM processes and tooling.
* Develop actionable plans to address and rectify identified gaps.

**Strategic Planning:**


* Distinguish between strategic and tactical initiatives.
* Propose a balanced approach that includes long-term strategies and quick wins.

**Privileged Access Management (PAM) Review:**


* Assess current PAM practices and identify requirements for improvement.
* Review admin usage (such as local, system & enterprise admins) and propose strategies to minimize risks.
* Recommend best practices for PAM implementation and management.

**Qualifications:**


* Proven experience in Identity Access Management, with a focus on strategic planning and implementation.
* Proven experience with Entra ID as primary SSO solution. Having Microsoft SC-300 certification is a bonus.
* Strong understanding of IAM processes, tools, and best practices.
* Experience with Privileged Access Management (PAM), including local admin usage, and password safe solutions.
* Familiarity with Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA) technologies and strategies.
* Ability to conduct gap analysis and develop strategic plans.
* Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills.
* Relevant certifications in IAM or related fields are a plus.

**What we offer**

  

* Professional growth - to work with the most talented developers in the industry.
* Modern technology - we invest in the latest technologies and tools and encourage our team members to share their ideas and take ownership of their work.
* Innovation - to work on exciting projects that push the boundaries of our industry and make a real impact.
* Commitment to quality - a dynamic and forward-thinking company that values profitable and long-term product development.

**Excited?**  

If you are excited about being part of a successful team, apply for this position!


Why we formed Odevo  

About Odevo  

Our Software

title: Information Security GRC Analyst
description:
Odevo is a group of exciting brands with a shared vision of challenging status quo in the property management industry. We are committed to revolutionizing the industry with innovative software solutions that make managing properties easier, more efficient, and more effective. Our rapidly growing product and engineering organization now includes around 200 highly skilled professionals.


Our cloud-based platform is unique, and in a brief time, we have proven ourselves as a leading and innovative player on the market. Our product development department acts as a SaaS supplier to all the companies in the Odevo group and several other players in the industry. Together, we will continue to challenge and change this industry. To continue our ambitious growth journey, we seek more great people to join us to build market-leading property management software products. Are you one of them?

**About the role**


Join our dynamic team at Odevo as a passionate Information Security GRC Analyst and play a pivotal role in fortifying our information security landscape! We are on the lookout for a talented individual who is eager to contribute to Odevo’s success. In this exciting position, you'll have the opportunity to design and lead our supplier due diligence program, craft engaging security awareness training, and orchestrate realistic phishing simulations. You'll also be instrumental in shaping a robust information security governance framework, and supporting the development and upkeep of our disaster recovery (DR) plans. Additionally, you'll ensure our sub-businesses are aligned with our security standards, making a significant impact on our overall compliance. If you're ready to take on a challenge and make a true difference, we want to hear from you


**Key Responsibilities:**


* **Supplier Due Diligence Program:**
* Develop and implement a risk-based supplier due diligence program.
* Assess supplier security practices and ensure compliance with company standards.
* **Security Awareness Training:**
* Implement and manage security awareness training programs.
* Create and send phishing simulation emails to test employee awareness.
* Analyze results and produce metrics to identify areas for improvement.
* **Information Security Policies:**
* Create and manage information security policies to ensure compliance and best practices.
* **Disaster Recovery (DR) Plans:**
* Support the creation and maintenance of disaster recovery plans.
* Collaborate with stakeholders to ensure DR plans are comprehensive and effective.
* **Track Compliance to Security Initiatives**:
* Work with IT representatives to monitor compliance with Odevo baselines for security implementations in the cloud and across security tooling.
* Report on compliance to management

**Who You Are:**


You possess strong communication skills, enabling you to effectively engage with both technical and non-technical stakeholders. Your detail-oriented nature and proactive approach to problem-solving and solution design make you adept at working with security GRC challenges, translating them into clear and actionable security insights. You are fluent in English and it is an added bonus if you know additional languages such as Spanish, Italian, Portuguese, German, Swedish or Finnish.


**Experience:**


* 2+ years of proven experience in a similar role.
* Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills.
* Proven experience in information security assurance, with a focus on supplier due diligence and security awareness training.
* Strong understanding of information security policies and best practices.
* Experience in conducting phishing simulations and analysing results.
* Some understanding of security certifications, frameworks and regulations (e.g ISO27001, NIST Cyber Framework, NIS2, DORA).

**Desired experience (but not required):**

* Technical knowledge of security principles, concepts, and technologies.
* Previous experience in aligning to security certifications and regulations (e.g ISO27001, NIS2, DORA)
* Familiarity with disaster recovery planning and implementation.
* Degree in Risk Management, Information Security or a related field.
* Relevant certifications in Information Security GRC or related fields.

**What we offer**

  

* Professional growth - to work with the most talented developers in the industry.
* Modern technology - we invest in the latest technologies and tools and encourage our team members to share their ideas and take ownership of their work.
* Innovation - to work on exciting projects that push the boundaries of our industry and make a real impact.
* Commitment to quality - a dynamic and forward-thinking company that values profitable and long-term product development.

**Excited?**  

If you are excited about being part of a successful team, apply for this position!


Why we formed Odevo  

About Odevo

title: Senior CloudOps Engineer - Nykundsprojekt
description:
***Om Norteam***

*Norteam är inte bara ett IT-bolag – vi är ett team av engagerade människor som brinner för att göra skillnad. Med Microsofts ekosystem som grund hjälper vi företag att bli smartare, säkrare och mer hållbara. Vi har en kultur där du får vara dig själv, växa och ha kul på jobbet. Vår vision är enkel: IT can be more – och vi lever den varje dag.*

*Norteam är ett av Sveriges snabbast växande IT-bolag, ett faktum som för med sig naturliga utmaningar men också fantastiska möjligheter. Alla kollegor är nyckelpersoner i sina olika roller. Alla har möjlighet att- och förväntas bidra till teknik & tjänstepaketering, affärsutveckling och sälj – och inte minst, till kultur & vårt långsiktiga bolagsbyggande.*

*Vill du ta en central roll på resan tillsammans med oss alla på Norteam? Läs vidare!*

**Vad gör du som Senior CloudOps Engineer i Norteams Projektteam?**


Som Senior CloudOps Engineer med placering i projektteamet ligger fokus på nykundsprojekt och driftsättning – du leder arbetet med att designa, sätta upp och implementera helt nya molnmiljöer i Microsofts ekosystem. Du arbetar nära projektledare och kundteam för att säkerställa att varje leverans blir säker, skalbar och modern.

  

Du har en avgörande roll i att säkerställa stabilitet, säkerhet och effektivitet i våra IT-tjänster. Du arbetar med avancerad felsökning, optimering och förbättring av våra kunders moln- och nätverksinfrastrukturer, särskilt inom Microsoft 365 och Azure. Du är en viktig kunskapsresurs och mentor för Projektteamet och du samverkar tätt med dina kollegor inom förvaltnings- och utvecklingsorganisationen.


Du samarbetar nära Cloud Engineers & andra tekniska funktioner för att säkerställa att våra tjänster är skalbara, effektiva och kostnadseffektiva. Du bidrar även till att organisationens IT-miljö uppfyller säkerhetsstandarder och regelverk, och deltar i säkerhetsgranskningar och hotanalyser.


Du förväntas också bidra i det kontinuerliga arbetet kring hur vi paketerar våra produkter och tjänster gentemot våra kunder. Du har örat mot rälsen och förväntas bidra med omvärldsanalys och kunskap om ny teknologi.

**Hos oss får du möjlighet att:**

* Planera och genomföra nykundsleveranser – från design till driftsättning
* Designa, implementera och optimera Azure- och Microsoft 365-tjänster
* Hantera lösningar inom PaaS (Platform as a Service) och IaaS (Infrastructure as a Service), inklusive Azure VM, Azure Virtual Desktop, Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS), Azure Container Apps m.m.
* Driva förbättringsprojekt inom moln, nätverk och IT-säkerhet
* Utveckla och implementera automatiseringslösningar för drift och hantering
* Fungera som teknisk expert och stöd för IT-support och infrastrukturteam
* Ansvara för felsökning och hantering av komplexa tekniska incidenter
* Stödja säkerhetsarbete genom säkerhetsoptimering och efterlevnad av policyer, bl a genom att implementera och hantera Azure Policy, RBAC och Workload Identity Federation
* Samarbeta med leverantörer och partners vid tekniska installationer och projekt
* Testa och utvärdera nya tekniska lösningar för att säkerställa innovation och utveckling

**Vem är du?**


Du är en Senior CloudOps Engineer med flerårig erfarenhet av att designa, driftsätta och underhålla komplexa Cloudmiljöer, med fokus på Azure. Du trivs i en projektorienterad miljö och har erfarenhet av att sätta upp nya miljöer från grunden.


Du är självgående och initiativtagande med ett lösningsorienterat mindset. Du tar stort eget ansvar och du bidrar till ständiga förbättringar inom ditt specialistområde. Du tar för dig, identifierar arbetsuppgifter & behov hos Norteams kunder och du är duktig på att strukturera och prioritera ditt arbete.


Vi tror också att du har en affärsmässig skärpa och helhetsblick som skapar förutsättningar att inte bara arbeta tekniskt, utan även att kunna bidra till utveckling av Norteams produkter & tjänster inom Microsoft Cloud.


Vi värdesätter också nyfikenhet & utvecklingsvilja – en drivkraft att utveckla din kompetens, omsätta ny kunskap i praktiken och inspirera kollegor genom att dela med dig av insikter och idéer.

**Du bör ha:**

* Erfarenhet av nykundsprojekt, nyuppsättning och driftsättning av nya cloudmiljöer
* Erfarenhet av olika public cloud-miljöer (Azure/AWS/GCP)
* Certifieringar såsom AZ-104, AZ-204 och AZ-305
* Erfarenhet av M365-lösningar såsom Intune, säkerhet och identitetshantering
* Erfarenhet av olika nätverkslösningar
* Erfarenhet av att utveckla och paketera nya produkter & tjänster
* Erfarenhet av Azure Landing Zones, Infrastructure as Code (Terraform, Bicep)
* Mycket god svenska och engelska, i både tal och skrift

**Ett stort plus om du också har:**

* Erfarenhet av datamigrering
* Erfarenhet av övervakning & larmhantering såsom NOC och/eller SOC
* Erfarenhet av Automation & scripting
* Erfarenhet av Certifikathantering & PKI
* Erfarenhet av ITIL-processer, primärt Change Management

**Övrigt**

* Placeringsort är Stockholm, Bromma
* Arbete till största del från kontoret, med möjlighet till hybrid-lösning
* Start så snart som möjligt

**Vad erbjuder vi?**

* En dynamisk och utvecklande miljö med engagerade kollegor
* Gemensamma aktiviteter, tävlingar och årlig konferensresa utomlands
* Frihet att välja de verktyg du behöver för att lyckas
* Eget gym, friskvård och generösa sociala ytor på kontoret
* Tjänstepension, föräldralön och sjukvårdsförsäkring
* Möjlighet att påverka och vara med på vår tillväxtresa
  

**Redo att ta nästa steg?**


Skicka in din ansökan eller hör av dig för ett förutsättningslöst samtal – vi är alltid nyfikna på nya stjärnor! Urvalet sker löpande, så vänta inte för länge.


För frågor om Norteam eller rollen – kontakta David von Grothusen. Talent Acquisition Lead på Norteam, david.von.grothusen@norteam.se.

 **Välkommen till Norteam – IT can be more!**

title: Data Scientist, Generative AI
description:
Nordnet redefined the financial world as the first digital bank in Europe. Now we are about to do it again—this time by putting AI at the heart of our customer experience. We're taking a new step by establishing the AI Customer Product team to scale Generative AI solutions that help our customers become better savers and investors.
  

  

We're searching for a Data Scientist to join Nordnet's AIR (AI & Research) function, working embedded within the AI Customer Product team. Your mission: evolve our existing GenAI capabilities into robust, customer-facing features across our app and web platform.

 **The Setup**


You'll be the second Data Scientist on this new team, working alongside full-stack engineers to tackle the full lifecycle—from exploring possibilities to deploying production features and iterating based on customer impact. Our technical foundation is Google Cloud Platform, where we've already deployed GenAI features serving customers. Now we're scaling what works and developing new capabilities.


This is not a theoretical role; you're a builder and problem-solver who thrives on iteration. You'll report to our Data Science Manager while working daily with the product squad.

 **What You'll Do**

**Develop GenAI solutions** that help customers make better investment decisions.

**Build production AI pipelines** from experimentation through deployment and monitoring.

 **Collaborate with engineers** throughout the development cycle—you'll work together on architecture and implementation in an iterative fashion.

 **Drive quality** through evaluation, metrics, and testing of AI solutions.

**Share insights** and recommendations with cross-functional stakeholders

**Champion AI Governance** - Ensure compliance with the bank's regulatory framework by clarifying **AI concepts and risks**

 **This is you**


You take pride in your work and are driven by curiosity—you want to continuously learn and grow. You want to see your work in customers' hands and enjoy the full spectrum from analysis to production code.


You likely have:

* Product experience with LLMs and GenAI.
* Python skills for both exploration and production code.
* SQL proficiency for data analysis and pipeline building.
* Experience with ML/AI in cloud environments (GCP experience is a plus).
* Knowledge of ML/AI evaluation, metrics, and best practices.
* Experience with pairing, code reviews, and shared problem-solving.


We also get excited if you have:

* Experience working embedded in product teams.
* Comfort presenting technical work to diverse audiences.
* Interest in finance, investing, or personal finance.


We think that you have 3+ years experience working as a Data Scientist or AI Engineer with a University degree in data science, computer science, statistics, mathematics, engineering or similar field.

 **We offer**

* Work in a product-focused environment with direct impact
* Growth opportunities as a data scientist in a fast-moving AI space
* Competitive salary and compensation


You'll work in a Nordic environment with high ambitions and a strong focus on delivery, product development, and technology. AI is central to our strategy, and you'll embark on a challenging journey alongside a skillful team of sharp and committed colleagues.


Culture is built and cared for, each day by everyone. We're proud of ours. Having a flat organization where anyone can talk to anyone creates a warm and friendly atmosphere worth protecting. We believe in a culture where every effort counts and where everyone is recognized—a culture embracing our core values of passion, simplicity, and transparency on all levels, no matter who you are or what you do.


We are over 900 employees in Stockholm, Oslo, Helsinki, Copenhagen and soon Frankfurt.


Visit us on www.nordnetab.com, www.nordnet.se, www.nordnet.no, www.nordnet.dk and www.nordnet.fi.

 **Application**


We will start interviewing immediately. Please note that we do only accept applications through our recruitment system, hence no email applications will be considered.


If you have questions, please contact Talent Acquisition Partner jill.holmgren@nordnet.se


We want to inform you that Nordnet conducts credit and background checks on the final candidate.  

  

We look forward to receiving your application!

title: Talent Acquisition Specialist
description:
Francisca heter jag och leder Talent Acquisition-arbetet på Redeploy.Vi är ett specialistkonsultbolag inom Cloud, Data och AI, där våra konsulter hjälper några av Nordens mest ambitiösa företag att bygga moderna, skalbara och riktigt robusta tekniska lösningar.


Redeploy består av runt 100 experter som brinner för teknik och för att göra ett bra jobb, och vi är partners till Microsoft, AWS och Databricks. Vi jobbar nära kundernas arkitektur- och utvecklingsteam, och vårt arbete spänner över allt från dataplattformar och modern analytics till AI-lösningar och avancerad cloud-infrastruktur.


Det gör också att rekryteringen hos oss är både komplex, nischad och väldigt, väldigt rolig. Nu ska vi växa ytterligare och jag behöver en kollega som vill vara med och bygga vidare på allt vi gör.

#### **Vad du kommer in i**

  

Nästa år kommer vi att ha ett högt rekryteringstempo. Vi arbetar med några av marknadens mest eftertraktade profiler, bland annat Cloud Engineers, Data Engineers, Analytics Engineers, AI Engineers, arkitekter och managementkonsulter.


För att lyckas behöver vi vara relevanta, snabba och riktigt vassa i hur vi attraherar talang. Detta är inte en roll där du sitter och tar emot ansökningar. Det här är en roll där du kommer vara med och driva och utveckla arbetet.

#### **Hur våra dagar ser ut**

  

Du och jag kommer arbeta nära varandra i allt som rör TA på Redeploy. En helt vanlig vecka hos oss innehåller till exempel:

* Sourcing och headhunting av nischade tekniska roller
* Första samtal med kandidater och löpande processdialoger
* Nära samarbete med rekryterande chefer som brinner för sina områden och ger snabb feedback
* Employer branding, studentmässor, events, community-initiativ och contentidéer
* Administration, koordinering och andra delar som håller processerna på plats
* Förbättringsarbete i små och stora steg, till exempel utbildningar, processutveckling och datadrivet TA


Till en början kommer du främst att stötta mig i att öka takten i sourcing och headhunting. Det är där vi har störst behov just nu. På sikt kommer du få utvecklas i hela TA-bredden och även fördjupa dig i områden som känns spännande för dig, till exempel DEI, datadriven rekrytering, processdesign, utbildningar eller employer branding.

#### **Vad vi vill bygga tillsammans**

  

Min målbild är att TA ska vara en strategisk partner för våra rekryterande chefer och en viktig del av att göra Redeploy till den mest attraktiva arbetsgivaren inom Cloud, Data och AI.


Det betyder att vi vill skapa:

* moderna, tydliga och datadrivna processer
* en kandidatresa som känns professionell och personlig
* smarta och kreativa sourcingstrategier
* ett employer brand som står ut på en konkurrensutsatt marknad
* en TA-funktion som fungerar som ett team och inte en ensam ö


Det är precis det jag vill att du ska vara med och utveckla.

#### **Vem du är**

  

Jag tror att du:

* har ungefär ett års erfarenhet av TA, sourcing eller rekrytering inom tech
* är trygg i LinkedIn Recruiter och gillar att leta efter talang på kreativa sätt
* är strukturerad, nyfiken och kommunikativ
* vill förstå hur Cloud, Data och AI hänger ihop
* vågar ta initiativ, kavla upp armarna när det behövs och är en doer som gärna säger “jag fixar det” och också tar tag i det
* vill växa snabbt inom TA och tycker om att bygga saker tillsammans med andra
* behärskar svenska och engelska flytande i tal och skrift.

#### **Vem jag är och hur vi kommer jobba**

  

Jag tror på tydlighet, trygghet och högt i tak. Jag vill att vi ska kunna bolla snabbt, ställa frågor fritt och utvecklas tillsammans. Du kommer få stöd, coaching och möjlighet att växa i ett högt tempo, men också frihet att forma ditt eget arbetssätt.


Och en sak som är viktig för mig. Jag vill att vi ska ha kul tillsammans. Det här ska inte bara vara ett jobb där vi springer från process till process. Jag vill att vi ska kunna skratta, prata om annat än jobb och känna att vi är ett team på riktigt. För mig är det minst lika viktigt som det operativa.

#### **Är det här du?**

  

Sök gärna om du känner att beskrivningen stämmer in på dig. Du får också höra av dig om du vill ställa frågor eller känna in rollen lite innan du ansöker.  

  

Vi ser gärna att du kan börja så snart som möjligt. Det är inte ett krav, men ett plus eftersom vi har mycket spännande på gång och vill komma igång tillsammans.  

  

Om du har möjlighet att börja tidigare är det ett stort plus för oss. Vi har ett högt rekryteringstryck just nu och det skulle vara värdefullt att komma igång tillsammans snabbt. Men viktigast är att vi hittar rätt person.  

  

Ansökningar tar vi emot via vår karriärsida enligt GDPR.


Jag hoppas vi hörs!

title: Technical Account Manager, Google Cloud Consulting
description:
### **Minimum qualifications:**

* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, a related technical field, or equivalent practical experience.
* 5 years of experience in a customer-facing role working with stakeholders, driving customer technical implementations or transformation programs.
* Experience supporting customers in cloud operations (e.g., launch or capacity planning, product release management), technical support, escalation management, or IT consulting.

  

### **Preferred qualifications:**

* MBA or Master’s degree in a Management, Technical, or Engineering field.
* Experience translating business requirements into technological solutions.
* Experience in application or workload migration to public cloud providers.
* Experience collaborating with teams, groups, business units, channel partners, systems integrators, and third-party developers to deliver high-impact solutions.
* Understanding of IT operations, database systems, networking, IT security, application development, service architecture, cloud-native application development, hosted services, storage systems, or content delivery networks.
* Ability to communicate in English and Swedish fluently to support client relationship management in this region.

**About the job**
-----------------


Our Google Cloud Consulting organization within Google Cloud delivers product and implementation expertise to our strategic customers to help them get the most out of their Google Cloud investments.  

  

As a Technical Account Manager (TAM), you will draw on our customer-facing skills and technical acumen to help customers successfully adopt Google Cloud products. Your previous experience with cloud infrastructure, program management, enterprise technology implementation, strategy development and customer advocacy will play a critical part in your day to day work driving success at our most critical customers. You will lead the successful adoption of Google Cloud at leading organizations, guiding them through the strategic and technical facets of their Cloud transformation journey.  


In this role, you will drive customer adoption of Google Cloud services, like Google Compute Engine, Vertex AI, Google Kubernetes Engine, BigQuery, and many more. You will regularly engage with stakeholder groups, including executives of large enterprises and a cross-functional and geographically dispersed team. You will utilize relationship management skills and technical credibility to effectively communicate at all levels of the organization, establishing themselves as a trusted advisor.  

  

Travel (domestically and internationally) up to approximately 20% of the time as needed.
Google Cloud accelerates every organization’s ability to digitally transform its business and industry. We deliver enterprise-grade solutions that leverage Google’s cutting-edge technology, and tools that help developers build more sustainably. Customers in more than 200 countries and territories turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to enable growth and solve their most critical business problems.

**Responsibilities**
--------------------

* Accelerate customer adoption of Google Cloud by leading the implementation journey. Provide technical guidance and manage timelines, milestones, migration goal and business transformation strategies.
* Advocate for customer needs in order to overcome adoption blockers and drive new feature development. Lead across multiple work streams and teams to maintain customer momentum.
* Develop relationships with stakeholders to understand customer’s business, develop strategic roadmaps, and lead quarterly business reviews and executive sessions to better understand business and technical needs.
* Plan for customer events and launches, partnering with Support, Engineers, and Site Reliability Engineers to ensure customer success, and work with customers and Support to guide issues/escalations to resolution.
* Develop best practices and assets based on learnings from customer engagements to support initiatives to scale through partners and accelerate Google Cloud adoption.
Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form.

title: Service Owner Productivity
description:
*Join PolyPeptide on our digital transformation journey*


PolyPeptide is on an exciting growth trajectory – expanding globally, investing in new technologies, and continuously improving our digital workplace to support our people across six international sites. As a leading CDMO for peptide- and oligonucleotide-based active pharmaceutical ingredients, we contribute to the health of millions of patients worldwide.


To strengthen our global End User Enablement team, we are now looking for a Service Owner – Productivity to take ownership of our productivity platforms and help shape the future of collaboration and digital work at PolyPeptide.

**Why join us?**


In this role, you will have the opportunity to influence how employees across all sites collaborate, communicate, and work digitally. You will play a pivotal role in our cloud journey and contribute directly to building a modern, secure, and efficient digital workplace. You will join a committed, international IT organization where innovation, teamwork, and continuous improvement are core elements of our culture.

**About the Role**


As Service Owner – Productivity, you will take end-to-end responsibility for key productivity services including Microsoft 365, Power Platform, conference room technologies, and digital signage solutions. You will ensure that these platforms are reliable, compliant, and continuously optimized — and you will be hands-on in configuration, governance, and driving adoption.


You will collaborate closely with global IT teams, PMO, business stakeholders, and local IT specialists across all sites. The role reports to the Head of Cloud & End User Enablement and is based in Limhamn, Sweden.


You will:

* Own and manage the lifecycle of assigned productivity services
* Develop and maintain service roadmaps aligned with business needs
* Drive adoption and support digital ways of working across the organization
* Establish Power Platform as a formalized and governed service area
* Ensure compliance with internal standards (QMS, GMP, GAMP)
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to support global sites, including India
* Lead and contribute to projects related to the digital workplace
* Provide third-line support and facilitate knowledge sharing

**Your Profile**


We are looking for a proactive and technically strong professional who thrives in a global environment and enjoys taking ownership.


You bring:

* 10+ years of relevant IT experience within service management or productivity platforms
* Deep knowledge of the Microsoft 365 ecosystem
* Experience with Power Platform and governance best practices
* Understanding of AV solutions and digital signage technologies
* Strong stakeholder management and communication skills
* Ability to translate complex IT concepts into business-friendly language
* Fluent English skills
* Experience in regulated environments (GxP/GMP) is a plus

Preferred certifications include Microsoft Enterprise Administrator Expert, Power Platform Functional Consultant, or ITIL Foundation.

**About us**


PolyPeptide Group AG and its consolidated subsidiaries (“PolyPeptide”) is a specialized Contract Development & Manufacturing Organization (CDMO) for peptide- and oligonucleotide-based active pharmaceutical ingredients. By supporting its customers mainly in pharma and biotech, it contributes to the health of millions of patients across the world. PolyPeptide serves a fast-growing market, offering products and services from pre-clinical through to commercial stages. Its broad portfolio reflects the opportunities in drug therapies across areas and with a large exposure to metabolic diseases, including GLP-1. Dating back to 1952, PolyPeptide today runs a global network of six GMP-certified facilities in Europe, the U.S. and India. PolyPeptide’s shares (SIX: PPGN) are listed on SIX Swiss Exchange.

**Our Values**

**Trust**: We build and maintain trust in all our relationships – both with each other and with our customers.  

**Innovation**: We are curious and driven by finding smart solutions to the challenges we face.  

**Excellence**: We always strive to deliver high quality and adapt to meet the needs of our customers.

**Interested? Apply now!**  

The position will remain open until December 13th, but we review applications on an ongoing basis. The role is based in Malmö, Sweden.


For more information, please contact Kristian Hagbyhn at Kristian.Hagbyhn@polypeptide.com. For Swedish applicants, you are welcome to contact the Unionen at +46 040-36 62 00 for support.

title: Customer Support Specialist (Nordics)
description:
**About Two**
 At
 **Two** 
 we're transforming the world of B2B commerce by reinventing how businesses pay and get paid. Our mission is to bring the speed, simplicity, and customer experience of B2C e-commerce into the B2B space, removing friction from business transactions and unlocking growth for merchants and buyers alike.
   

  

 We combine real-time credit decisioning, seamless checkout, and advanced risk assessment to power faster, smarter, and more efficient sales. With 30% month-on-month growth and operations across multiple European markets, we're scaling rapidly - on track to become the world's leading B2B payment solution by 2027.
   

  

 Backed by top-tier investors including Sequoia Capital, Shine, LocalGlobe, Antler, and some of the world's most respected fintech angels, we've raised over €40 million in equity to date. And we're just getting started!
   

  

 We're a diverse, ambitious team that values curiosity, impact, and ownership. Join us at Two and help shape the future of B2B payments!
   

  

**About The Role**
 We're looking for a motivated and curious Customer Support Specialist to join our global Customer Support team. You'll help our Swedish merchants get the most out of Two's platform, solving interesting problems and making a real impact on the customer experience.
   

  

 You won't just close tickets—you'll help shape how we serve our customers, improve processes, and ensure our merchants have smooth, efficient interactions with our platform. This is a great opportunity to grow your skills in a fast-moving fintech environment while contributing to a rapidly scaling company.
   

  

**Location**
 Two is a remote-friendly company with a flexible working policy that supports both onsite and remote collaboration. For this role, our ideal candidate would be based in our Stockholm office.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Support Key Merchants: Assist Swedish merchants with day-to-day platform issues, onboarding, and questions. Share knowledge with colleagues to help the team succeed.
* Handle Complex Cases: Support escalated or complicated issues via chat and email, ensuring merchants receive timely and accurate help.
* Customer Communication: Provide clear, empathetic, and professional support in both Swedish and English.
* Collaborate Across Teams: Work closely with Operations, Product, and Engineering teams to report issues, suggest improvements, and help fix recurring problems.
* Improve Processes: Help identify gaps in workflows or documentation and contribute ideas to make support more efficient.
* Learn and Grow: Build expertise in Two's platform, fintech tools, and B2B payments, and mentor colleagues as you gain experience


**Requirements**
* Experience in customer support, ideally 1-3 years, with some exposure to escalations or more complex cases.
* Fluent in Swedish (written and spoken) and strong English skills.
* Problem-solving mindset and willingness to take ownership of issues.
* Interest or experience in fintech, SaaS, or B2B payment systems is a plus but not required.
* Comfortable using CRM and ticketing tools like Zendesk or Intercom (experience is a plus)


**Recruitment Process**
 Our interview process is structured, fair, and designed to help you showcase your strengths.
   

  

* Introductory video call with Talent Team (up to 30 minutes)
* Interview with Hiring Manager (up to 1 hour)
* Take-Home Task / Case Study Interview (up to 1 hour)
* Final Interview (1 hour)


 We aim to move quickly - most candidates complete the process within 3-4 weeks.
   

  

**Benefits**
* SEK 5000 annual allowance to spend on anything that will contribute to your mental or physical health
* SEK 5000 annual allowance for learning and training
* SEK 5000 support for a cell phone every 24 months (from your 6th month anniversary)
* Equity - get options at Two as part of your offer, and have a real stake in the company's success
* Work on a cutting-edge B2B payment system, shaping the future of business to business payments
* Find your best way to work with our office-led, remote-friendly working framework!

title: Experienced professionals to our Insurance Engineering Team
description:
Deloitte is a leading global provider of Audit & Assurance, Tax & Legal, and Consultative Services. With more than 457,000 professionals in over 150 countries, we help our clients and society to solve complex problems and achieve ambitious goals. We are driven by one purpose: to make an impact that matters. To us, this means lasting results for our clients and their businesses, ideas and actions that contribute to a greater good. It also means empowering our people and supporting them in their growth journey.
   

  

  




**Job Description**

**Are you ready for the next step in your career and to be part of our successful team in Sweden?**




 Deloitte is seeking talented early-career professionals with 1–3 years of experience in the insurance industry who are eager to advance their skills in IT-enabled business transformation.
   

  

  





 As part of our Engineering team in Stockholm, you will collaborate closely with clients and Deloitte colleagues to plan and implement core business solutions that enhance operational efficiency and foster innovation. Leveraging your insurance domain expertise alongside strong technical and/or project management capabilities, you will lead and coordinate key activities across system design, development, testing, and deployment. You will also manage stakeholder engagement, oversee change management processes, ensure alignment with business objectives, and drive continuous improvement throughout the transformation lifecycle.
   

  

  





 Your background may include roles such as claims handler, IT business analyst, system implementation specialist, or similar positions within insurance. Experience in project management, test management, product management, or software development is highly valued. While not mandatory, familiarity with AI and cloud technologies is considered an advantage.
   

  

  





 This role offers a unique opportunity to deepen your expertise across both business and technology domains by contributing to IT-driven transformation projects that help clients modernize operations and adopt emerging technologies. You will work alongside experienced consultants and industry experts in a dynamic consulting environment.
   

  

  





**Core Responsibilities**




 Your core responsibilities will typically be:
   

  

  




* Lead workstreams or smaller projects within large-scale IT core transformation projects/programs
* Design, establish, and manage PMO functions to support large-scale transformations
* Engage and manage key stakeholders to enhance our understanding of client needs and build lasting relationships
* Ensure continuous alignment between project delivery and enterprise strategies
* Drive core project management activities, including planning, reporting, resource and risk management, budgeting, and financial oversight
* Collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams, including developers, testers business stakeholders and vendors
* Engage in continuous learning and professional development opportunities


**Qualifications**
* 1–3 years of professional experience within the insurance sector
* Graduate degree and proficiency in technology and business disciplines
* Relevant experience in system implementation, IT business analysis, system analysis, claims handling, insurance advisory, or similar operational roles
* Demonstrated interest or experience in IT transformations, project management, test management, product management, requirements management, data migration, software development, ITIL, and agile methodologies
* Understanding of end-to-end insurance related business processes
* Proven ability to collaborate effectively within team-oriented, client-facing environments
* Strong motivation to learn and develop professionally in a fast-paced consulting setting
* Basic knowledge and keen interest in AI and cloud technologies is considered an advantage
* Proficient user of Microsoft Excel, PowerPoint, and Word, with the ability to leverage these tools effectively in a professional context
* Professional proficiency in Swedish and English, both oral and written
* Flexibility to travel as required


**Additional Information**

**We offer**




 At Deloitte, we are committed to helping our employees grow and develop throughout their career. We offer a range of on-the-job learning experiences, formal development programs at Deloitte University, and access to a personal coach to support you in identifying and utilizing your strengths. We also provide the necessary training and resources for you to obtain various certifications to further advance in your career.
   

  

  

  

 Our culture is built on collaboration and innovation. We value diverse perspectives and encourage our employees to think creatively to find the best solutions for our clients. We work hand-in-hand with our clients to understand their unique needs and to develop tailored solutions that drive growth and innovation. At Deloitte, you´ll have the chance to grow and succeed alongside like-minded professionals who share your passion.
   

  

  

  

  




**Additional Information**

**How to Apply:**




 You apply online. Your application should consist of:
   

  

  




* CV
* Letter of motivation
	+ Why you are interested in Deloitte and the role as a consultant
	+ What you think you can contribute with and bring to the role


**Please submit your application as soon as possible, as we work with ongoing selection.**
  

  

  

*As a qualitative part of Deloitte's recruitment process, our final candidates undergo a background check, to increase awareness of our future employees, secure the working environment for our employees and meet regulatory requirements. The background check process is carried out in collaboration with ToFindOut.* 
*https://tofindout.se/en/background-check/*
  

  

  

**Questions?**

 If you have any questions regarding the role or the application process, please contact Anna Taube, Manager Talent Acquisition, at ataube@deloitte.se.
   

  

  

  

**We are looking forward to your application!**
  

  

  

 For further information on Deloitte, please visit www.deloitte.se
   

  

  





**What impact will you make?**




 Every day, your work will make an impact that matters, while you thrive in a dynamic culture of inclusion, collaboration and high performance. We do not just aspire to make solutions. We wish to create an impact that makes a positive and crucial difference for the people around us, our clients and our society. Deloitte is where you’ll find unlimited opportunities to succeed and realize your full potential.

title: IT Support Sweden
description:
*Do you want to be the person who makes technology simple, smooth, and stress-free for others? At GlobalConnect, we’re looking for an IT Supporter who shares our vision of making technology accessible and easy for every employee across our company.*
**About The Role**
 As an IT Supporter, you’ll be at the heart of our technical support operations. Some days, you’ll solve problems over the phone before the coffee even cools; other days, you’ll make sure new colleagues have everything they need to get started on their first day. You’ll help ensure our tools and systems work seamlessly so our teams can focus on what they do best.
   

  

 Your work will be varied — from hands-on troubleshooting to preparing new equipment, from guiding colleagues through technical questions to keeping our systems running smoothly. Every interaction is an opportunity to solve a problem, learn something new, and create a positive experience for someone else.
   

  

**Some Of Your Responsibilities Will Include**
* Providing first-line IT support via phone, email, and in person
* Setting up accounts, devices, and software for new employees
* Managing and resolving support tickets in ServiceNow or other ticketing systems
* Maintaining smooth operations in Microsoft 365, Azure Active Directory, and Active Directory environments


 This is a
 **temporary position until May 30th 2027.**
**Why join us?**
 At GlobalConnect, we believe technology should empower people, not frustrate them. Our IT team is friendly, solution-focused, and always ready to share knowledge. You’ll be part of a group that values teamwork and enjoys making everyday work life easier for colleagues across the Nordics.
   

  

 We also believe in giving you the space to learn and grow — whether that’s diving deeper into IT systems, exploring new tools, or finding smarter ways to work.
   

  

**To make an impact in this role, we think you’ll need:**
* An interest in IT and technology, and curiosity to keep learning
* Experience with Microsoft 365, Azure Active Directory, and/or Active Directory
* Experience with ServiceNow or other ticket management tools
* Fluency in Swedish and English, both spoken and written


 We don’t need a personal letter unless there’s something you’d like to explain that isn’t covered in your CV or LinkedIn profile.
   

  

**About Us**
 GlobalConnect is one of the leading connectivity providers in Northern Europe. We’re 2000 passionate and talented individuals who want to make a difference, turning our customers’ visions into reality through connectivity. Our goal is to create the best possible conditions for engaged employees, a place where you can develop and grow, and create unforgettable memories and enjoyable experiences.
   

  

 We have helped develop and digitize societies across the Nordics for more than two decades. Our purpose is what drives us to continue - turning visions into reality by empowering society with connectivity.

title: IT Consultant - Stockholm | BCG Platinion
description:
Who We Are
   

  

 Do you want to turn the challenges of digitalization into the solutions of the future? Join BCG Platinion in tackling the core IT issues of leading global companies. Deploy customized platforms, architectures, strategies, and organizations to leverage the digital potential of our customers and drive true innovation, with state-of-the-art tools such as cloud computing, AI, blockchain, microservices, and containerization. Add your individual strengths to our unique team, always there to support you. Together with Boston Consulting Group and our clients, we turn digital visions into reality.
   

  

 What You'll Do
   

  

 For our Stockholm office, we are looking for IT Consultants who will collaborate with colleagues from BCG Platinion and/or the Boston Consulting Group on local and international client projects!
   

  

 What You'll Bring
   

  

**You can help us make a difference if you**
* have a degree in computer science, informatics, business with focus on IT, or a related field
* gathered approx. two years of relevant experience in IT consulting (part or full time)
* are no stranger to the buzzwords machine learning, cyber resilience, DevOps, agile, AI, and robotics
* enjoy tackling complex digital challenges and are enthusiastic about developing and sharing solutions
* feel comfortable in interdisciplinary teams and global contexts and are flexible and willing to travel
* are excellent at understanding and communicating complex topics in English


 Who You'll Work With
   

  

**Shape the world of tomorrow**
* Shape the digital future of globally leading companies in an individual client context with overarching technical solutions
* Develop groundbreaking projects by enabling your clients to effectively use agile methods and modern approaches in the context of strategic IT implementation
* Smooth the path for tailored, future-oriented customer journeys based on precise analyses of the individual situation and with current market developments and trends such as machine learning in mind
* Design and optimize unique IT architectures within the framework of enterprise solution requirements, modern custom software developments, and sustainable digital solutions, including cyber resilience


 Additional info
   

  

**How To Grow With Us**
 We guarantee constant development incentives in an open and rewarding work environment! Together with a dedicated team of talented colleagues, you get to work on new challenges every day. Individual training offers and a culture of open feedback will provide the framework needed to explore and perfect personal strengths. Our modern structures allow focusing on the essence of our work - with easy travel booking, an excellent back-office support and comprehensive Knowledge Center. With our regular office Fridays and legendary events, we nurture a strong and close team network beyond our case work.
   

  

*BCG Platinion is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity / expression, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected under national, provincial, or local law, where applicable.*
*#BCGPlatinion*
 Boston Consulting Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity / expression, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected under national, provincial, or local law, where applicable, and those with criminal histories will be considered in a manner consistent with applicable state and local laws.
   

  

 BCG is an E - Verify Employer. Click here for more information on E-Verify.

title: Azure Cloud Architect
description:
What makes Cognizant a unique place to work? The combination of rapid growth and an international and innovative environment! This is creating a lot of opportunities for people like YOU — people with an entrepreneurial spirit who want to make a difference in this world.
   

  

 At Cognizant, together with your colleagues from all around the world, you will collaborate on creating solutions for the world's leading companies and help them become more flexible, more innovative and successful. And this is your chance to be part of the success story: we are looking for Cloud Data Architect for our Cloud Infrastructure team.
   

  

**What You Bring**
* Design, implement, and manage scalable, secure, and highly available Azure cloud infrastructures.
* Design end-to-end Azure-based data architectures including ingestion, storage, processing, and consumption layers.
* Build and maintain virtual networks, subnets, firewalls, route tables, VPN gateways, and ExpressRoute.
* Develop and manage Infrastructure as Code (IaC) using Terraform, following GitOps principles.
* Collaborate with application and security teams to ensure optimal network configurations and cloud architecture.
* Monitor and troubleshoot Azure resources, ensuring high availability and performance.
* Implement best practices for cloud governance, cost optimization, security, and compliance.


**Nice to have**
* Create and manage CI/CD pipelines in Azure DevOps for infrastructure provisioning and application deployment
* Secure handling of credentials and secrets using GitHub Secrets and environment variables.
* Implementing Git flos, trunk-based development, or feature branching for collaborative development
